terms.definition: Official records and documents that demonstrate adherence to regulatory standards, laws, and industry requirements for product safety and quality.
Federal Communications Commission - U.S. regulatory agency that certifies electronic devices for electromagnetic compatibility and radio frequency emissions.
Conformité Européenne - European conformity marking indicating that a product complies with EU health, safety, and environmental protection standards.
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to view revision history and revert to previous versions.
A single, unified storage location where all documents, files, and data are organized and accessible to authorized users from one place.
A chronological record of all changes, access, and activities performed on documents or systems, used for compliance verification and security purposes.
Electromagnetic Compatibility - the ability of electronic devices to function properly without interfering with or being affected by other electronic equipment.
Restriction of Hazardous Substances - EU directive that restricts the use of specific hazardous materials in electrical and electronic products.
Registration, Evaluation, Authorisation and Restriction of Chemicals - EU regulation governing the production and use of chemical substances in products.
terms.expanded: Registration, Evaluation, Authorisation and Restriction of Chemicals

terms.definition: The use of software to automatically execute business processes and tasks according to predefined rules, reducing manual intervention and errors.
A systematic approach to tracking, documenting, and implementing modifications to processes, documents, or systems while maintaining compliance and quality.
Teamwork between different departments or specialized groups within an organization to achieve common goals and share expertise.
Underwriters Laboratories - independent safety certification organization that tests and certifies products for safety standards in North America.
Structured processes that route documents through designated reviewers and approvers in a specific sequence before final authorization.
A visual grid or table that maps products, requirements, or processes against various regulatory standards to show adherence status across multiple jurisdictions.
